p: Flaviviruses are defined by their antigenic relatedness, among other things, and all exhibit various degrees of cross-reactivity profiles in serological tests ( Mansfield et al., 2011). Flaviviruses were first grouped together as Group B arboviruses based on cross-species hemagglutination inhibition (HI) and later divided into eight serocomplexes comprised of 49 viruses on the basis of cross-neutralization tests ( Calisher et al., 1989). Serocomplexes correspond to amino acid distances over the E protein. Serocomplexes themselves exhibit varying degrees of antigenic similarity.
